cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.DM, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with algorithms for string processing and data structures, which are typically covered in the computer science categories of arXiv. Specifically, the paper proposes a new algorithm for Burrows-Wheeler transform (BWT) construction, which is a fundamental problem in string processing and compression. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) category. Additionally, the paper introduces a novel concept of string synchronizing sets, which may be of interest to researchers in the areas of combinatorics (cs.DM) and information theory (cs.IT). The paper also presents an optimal data structure for answering Longest Common Extension (LCE) queries, which is a problem in string processing and pattern matching, and may be relevant to researchers in the areas of algorithms and computational complexity (cs.CC) and machine learning (cs.LG).
